bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Laura Wood, November 27, 1941

div1.p: Hench informs Wood that the handwriting in the notebook has been identified as belonging to Lazear.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Laura Wood, November 27, 1941
div1.opener:
Charge to the account of_________________________________$___________
WESTERN
UNION
1206-B
R. B. WHITE
PRESIDENT
NEWCOMB CARLTON
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
J. C. WILLEVER
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
__________________________________________________
Send the following telegram, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
11/27/41
LAURA WOOD 1338 19TH ST NW
WASHINGTON DC
div1.p:
HOORAY FOR YOU HAVE COMPARED PHOTOSTATS WITH HANDWRITINGS
OR REED, AGRAMONTE, CARROLL, LAZEAR. NOTEBOOK IS POSITIVELY
LAZEARS AM ABSOLUTELY CERTAIN BUT SENDING COPIES FOR MRS LAZEARS
FINAL CONFIRMATION MAY CONTAIN INFORMATION EVEN MORE VALUABLE TO
ME THAN STILL MISSING POCKET NOTEBOOK. HAVE WRITTEN MALLOCH
WILL KEEP YOU INFORMED THANKS LOADS.
